page.title: 19Tockwith Charity Work
page.content: Auction for Ethiopia held in Tockwith Village Hall. In the last year the focus of the world's attention has been the famine in East Africa caused mainly by droughts in successive years. 4 local people, members of Tockwith Church, decided to organize an auction to raise money for the starving people of Ethiopia. The auction was advertised on local TV and radio. It was held in the Village Hall on Saturday, 29th.January 1985. People from all around brought unwanted things, ornaments, bicyles, baby equipment, and furniture etc. The auctioneer was Peter Gibson, a well-known Tockwith resident. About 200 people came, some from York and Leeds. The Â£600 which was raised far exceeded expectations. The money was sent to Christian Aid, for Ethiopia.
